page.title: 06Farming changes:SW.Cheshire.
page.content: On the Grosvenor Estate,east of Saighton & on Hattonheath farm,some very large fields have been created by the removal of hedges to create a "Prairie-type" landscape.These are now used for the large-scale,mechanised, cultivation of cereals,brought about by the European Economic Community reducing the milk production allowed, so less grassland is needed for fewer cattle (the Estate overall now has 1 less herd).Moveable electric fences allow these large fields to be still sub-divided to control cattle but hedge removal means less wildlife & perhaps soil erosion.There have been some redundancies,as animals for milk require more labour than crops & also the number of milkings per day has been reduced from 3 to 2.Lower quotas have caused little complete job loss on the family-run farms of the area.
